orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg reports and produce a PDDL domain and problem that solves the Tower of Hanoi instance with 4 disks moving from left to right under the standard rules.

public_information: This is a Tower of Hanoi puzzle with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 4 disks labeled A, B, C, D where A is the smallest and D is the largest.
Legal moves: move exactly one top disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top to bottom) A, B, C, D. Middle peg is empty. Right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: right peg has (top to bottom) A, B, C, D. Left and middle pegs are empty.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in generating PDDL domain and problem files compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Based on the peg reports you will produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi with three pegs and four disks. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the model enforces single-disk moves and the rule forbidding larger disks on smaller ones.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive three peg state descriptions: {state_left}, {state_middle}, {state_right}. Use these descriptions and the public information {environment->public_information} and the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal} to produce a full PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted for the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent contributions distinct in your reasoning. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem> tags.
